result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherriann M Weis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherriann M Weis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sherriann M Weis in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
from Atty Kryshak requesting to reschedule trial date.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 03-31-2016 08:30 am
Certification
from Attorney Lambert
from Attorney Kryshak
for Motion Hearing held February 16, 2015.  (Michelle L. Peterson, Court Reporter)
from District Attorney's Office
Exhibits 1- 8

Defendant Sherriann Weis in court with attorney Gary Kryshak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scott Saeger sworn in.  Exhibit 1 - Complaint for search warrant submitted and received.  Witness testifies to employment with Wood County Sheriff's Department.  Testifies he was the investigator in case.  Testifies to surveillance of defendant's property. Exhibit 2 - photo of defendant's property.   Exhibit 3 - photo of defendant's property.  Exhibit 4 - photo of defendant's property. Witness testifies he took photos of defendant's property and describes photos.  Exhibit 5 - Photo of property.  Exhibit 6 - Parcel info for property adjacent to defendant's property.  Exhibit 7 - photo of plants located on defendant's property.  Exhibit 8 - photo of plants located on defendant's property.  Witness describes process in obtaining search warrant.  
Cross by Attorney Sheets.  Describes conversation with citizen informant.  
Cross by Attorney Kryshak.  
Redirect by Attorney Lambert.  
All exhibits are received.  
Court orders parties to write briefs.  Attorney Lambert to file brief within 30 days.  Attorney Sheets to respond within 30 days.
to Suppress
cover letter from Attorney Kryshak with Motion to Suppress
Jury trial - 12 person on January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
(Defendant)
from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated October 28, 2014, re Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Steven A Novak in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Sherriann Weiss in court with Attorney Gary Kryshak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Nathan Reblin sworn in.  Testifies to his employment and experience as a law enforcement officer.  Testifies to executing search warrant at defendant's address. Home is owned by Steven Novak  Officer Reblin identifies defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to evidence found at defendant's residence.  Testifies Sherriann Weiss was the sole occupant of the home at time of search warrant.  Testifies Steven Novak admitted to growing marijuana. 

Cross by Attorney Kryshak. Testifies to knowledge of Sherriann Weiss residing in residence.  

Cross by Attorney Sheets. Testifies to location of marijuana growing outside residence.  Testifies to weight of marijuana plants that were confiscated. Testifies aerial photographs taken of marijuana plants. 

Probable cause found.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 27, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
